jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

E7A635B76E7C40CEB89340EAC718246C.description:
Compare government symbols and
traditions with our Catholic symbols
and traditions.

48C3DEE1A79D436D877A09904FD6CA3E.description:
Identify significant changes in
communication or technology that have
had an affect on the spread of political
information and influence (e.g.,
telegraph, television, internet).

BF9CD91504DA477EAD971992A4DB4299.description:
Describe historical examples featuring
the denial or extension of civil rights to
various individuals or groups.

8BF89AF1207A49FF954F41B40AAB00D8.description:
Compare the similarities found in
national symbols, legends, or stories
that have emphasized the value of such
principles as freedom, liberty,
preservation of the union, etc.

6FADC8AFC0404B3584E430CDE605D1F8.description:
Discuss consistencies and
inconsistencies expressed in United
States political traditions and actual
practices (e.g., freedom of speech, the
right to bear arms, slavery, voting
rights).

0C37021AFC9442BDBD38965078DD5905.description:
Describe examples of the developments
of basic freedoms for the people of the
United States.

0A96A5F6C7C04F96B7E9842A8E20E32C.description:
Understand the development of the United States political ideas and traditions. Understand the development of religious/spiritual aspects of the United States political ideas and traditions. Explain the history of the Catholic Church and its impact in human events. CSIS4     Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7         Value the significance and impact to the Catholic Church throughout history. CSDS5         Internalize Catholic virtues and values from the study of human history to better evaluate one’s own behaviors, the trends of contemporary
society, and prevalent social pressures and norms. CSDS4

8A446F5784F043E0952F3AA8CFCE6D5C.description:
Discuss the ways the Pope influences
foreign policy throughout the world.

825C01136A6B4FD6BA4D9CB2CE663231.description:
Describe how a specific issue (e.g.,
trade, resources, human rights) has
affected a president's foreign policy.

2279B73E006C46048B51EEABB9ABFCF7.description:
Identify a treaty the United States has
signed with another country.

2CC93541872C4FF1A50029E85C2DD02A.description:
Identify government branches and
offices at the federal level that are
responsible for conducting foreign
affairs.

A06961F7A22B4F6ABFA3637AEBAF604E.description:
Summarize how nations interact to
avoid conflict (e.g., diplomacy, trade,
treaties).

C9CA5BBE1B554E53821581EC803E20A7.description:
Understand United States foreign policy as it relates to other nations and international issues. Understand United States foreign policy as it relates to other nations and Catholic Church issues. Identify the motivating values that have informed particular societies and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7       Explain what is positive in the world, what needs to be changed, and what injustices must be overcome. CSDS4        Explore how the moral qualities of the citizenry naturally give rise to the nature of the government and influence societal outcomes and
destinies. CSIS13 (7&8)         Identify the dangers of relativism present in the notion that one culture cannot critique another, that truth is culturally created; or that truth is
not to be shared and celebrated wherever found. CSIS27 (7&8)

E8D00BEA9ECC4FDE8A5939C72B84F3EA.description:
Explain why Jesus calls us to a life of
service and to use our talents to serve
others.

66487D5CFD8C4A64BF77613000EC5B26.description:
Describe the impact of Catholic
politicians in the United States.

C552A0B3F19B4C8B8C09A749678F9695.description:
Compare/contrast contemporary and
traditional forms of political
persuasion.

7946EEC515DB44AC9DCEC81C94ECFCBB.description:
Explain ways that individuals and
groups influence the shaping of public
policy.

53C813B9B4B144428BFA4D7B8718C582.description:
Define the concept of "lobbying" to
influence public opinion or legislative
decision-making.

F19A9F82D4514F27AAB3A76385348B71.description:
Describe a situation where minority
rights may supersede the wishes of the
majority.

CC3A2F16D08D47C1A8263B170F4F5168.description:
Understand the roles and influences of individuals and interest groups in the political systems of Illinois, the United States, and other nations. Understand the roles and influences of individual Catholics and Catholic interest groups. Identify the differences among the values of various political systems and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7        Recognize how the central themes within the stories of important Catholic figures and saints repeat over time. CSIS6         Explore how the moral qualities of the citizenry naturally give rise to the nature of the government and influence societal outcomes and
destinies. CSIS13 (7&8)        Discuss thoughts and deeds of great men and women of the past. CSIS15

5CB3D3D58F03481DA70C31B545202E12.description:
Identify the issues of a candidate’s
campaign/platform and compare with
the teachings of the Church.

6E348589597C471ABE7FC647692A7262.description:
Explain how an individual or group has
solved a problem, in their community.

6FCFADA2C9424920AA208027FDA56AD4.description:
Predict the consequences of ignoring
the rights of other people in public
places.

4B09C93FA98048AAB3A33B82D7CF255E.description:
Describe situations in their home,
school, or community where the rights
of minorities have been respected.

03F853A27D7F4759ABF11EEBF4477EB5.description:
Understand election processes and responsibilities of citizens. Understand the election process and special responsibilities of Catholic citizens.  Value and develop a love for the common good and our shared humanity, not just with those around us, but for those who have gone before
and those that will come after us. CSDS2        Identify the motivating values that have informed particular societies and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7            Value one’s own role and dignity as man in God’s plan and creation. CSGS5         Compare the actions of peoples according to their historical and cultural norms to current Catholic moral norms and virtues. CSIS11 (7&8)

B5760832A10244C68DF9874B69AA839E.description:
Plan and/or participate in service
projects that help the community.

20201DAC0EA3416289136F4556AC76F7.description:
Recognize the importance of the
separation of Church and state.

B8C1C5AC95AE48858BB9894CA05FC87E.description:
Describe the system of checks and
balances between the three branches of
the federal government.

A1016273A0604982932BBB414E8CC83F.description:
Describe the purpose behind the
principles of division and sharing
powers among the executive,
legislative, and judicial branches.

6CD43E03CE244150A2CC8FB03B67712E.description:
State the names of the two houses in
the Illinois State Legislature.

3B81BDF022E6479EACD89725DB6F2309.description: Understand the structures and functions of the political systems of Illinois, the United States, and other nations. Understand the relationship of Church structure and functions to the structures and functions of the political systems of the United States and other nations.  Describe how we can learn about what God does for humanity. CSIS3       Understand and explain the human condition and the role and dignity of man in God’s plan. CSIS8         Discuss how Church structure and function can assist man in the acquisition of values and virtues. CSIS12           Identify what is positive in the world, what needs to be transformed, and what injustices must be overcome. CSDS4           Compare the actions of peoples according to their historical and cultural norms to current Catholic moral norms and virtues. CSIS11 (7&8)

DBD48F5D2789473E84C5A7B9DE9C2B9C.description:
Summarize the evolution of one of the
amendments to the constitution (e.g., its
origins, implementation, influence).

D00D4C55636249469DAF4E4003DE0117.description:
Defend the idea of having a Bill of
Rights to outline and protect the rights
of citizens.

56CE10165D154A5E883E6967BCC42822.description:
Compare the relationship of civic rules
and responsibilities to Church rules
and responsibilities.

AE160147F7104253ACD4E16A27372FF2.description:
Explain how the U.S. Constitution can
be amended.

48C2F7B1B5FA4BD099C24CAA1E0C7CF0.description:
Define the concept of "unalienable" as
it relates to rights expressed in the
Declaration of Independence.

D02402C3653F411DBC8823ECCECB8113.description:
Explain the importance of the
Declaration of Independence and the
Illinois and United States
Constitutions.

4901A1A4FCAE4922931B90B7CFA76BE3.description:
Justify/define why governments need to
make rules and laws for people.

6B3478A084F849E0B9415D2BC62619C0.description:
Give examples of civic and personal
responsibilities of students and adults.

2FB40FED49C748E591ECCE7E4BFE46E1.description:
Understand and explain basic principles of the United States government. Understand the relationship of basic principles for the U.S. Government and the Catholic Church Government. Understand what God does for humanity. CSIS3   Understand and explain the human condition and the role and dignity of man in God’s plan CSIS8        Examine how one’s own life and life-choices creates a personal history with eternal consequences. CSIS3 (7 &8)        Demonstrate the ways mankind and societies change and/or persist over time to better understand the human condition. CSIS8
(7&8)

E4D7732671724BC1843EC32CD991D341.description: Understand political systems, with an emphasis on the United States. Understand the relationship of the Church and its systems to political systems of the United States.
